alert.note: Alert for Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 5:59PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Crook County through 630 PM MDT... At 558 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Moorcroft, or 24 miles east of Gillette, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Keyhole Reservoir around 610 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pine Haven. This includes Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 157 and 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for northeastern Wyoming.
